title: Katy Perry drops new music video during the College Football halftime
description: Katy Perry and Alesso's new music video "When I'm Gone" premiered during the College Football Playoff National Championship, the first time ESPN launched a global music video during a live broadcast.

title: 'You personally attack me:' Dr. Fauci fires back at Sen. Paul in heated exchange
description: Dr. Anthony Fauci and Senator Rand Paul spar during a Senate health hearing and Dr. Fauci says he has received death threats while working to end the pandemic because of Paul's false claims.

title: Warren uses 'econ 101' to grill Jerome Powell
description: Sen. Elizabeth Warren questioned Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell about whether increased costs on goods can be attributed to corporations' market power.

title: Jimmy Kimmel fights back tears talking about Bob Saget
description: Late night host Jimmy Kimmel fought back tears talking about his friend Bob Saget during his monologue on ABC's 'Jimmy Kimmel Live.' HLN's Robin Meade reports.

title: Trump on Mike Rounds: 'I will never endorse this jerk again'
description: Senator Mike Rounds (R-SD) doubled down on Donald Trump's loss in the 2020 election after the former President criticized the GOP lawmaker. CNN political commentator SE Cupp reacts.

title: 'In walks the most gorgeous young girl': The moment Marilyn was discovered
description: "Who is this girl?" the head of casting at 20th Century Fox said when he met Marilyn Monroe during an audition. CNN's new series "Reframed: Marilyn Monroe" follows young Norma Jean as she becomes a Hollywood star. Tune in Sunday, January 16, at 9 p.m. ET.

title: US Covid hospitalizations at levels not seen since last winter
description: The spread of the Omicron variant is causing widespread disruption across the US as hospitalizations reach a level not seen since the 2020-21 holiday surge.

title: Crypto CEO becomes one of the world's richest billionaires
description: A cryptocurrency CEO has become one of the richest people on Earth.

title: The official urged nations to strengthen mask rules and warned that the window to act was closing
description: The Omicron variant is forecasted to infect more than half of all Europeans in the next six to eight weeks, a World Health Organization official said Tuesday as he urged nations to strengthen mask rules and warned that the window to act was closing.

title: WHO chief's recommendation on schools
Energy supplier apologizes after telling customers to cuddle pets to keep warm
description: A British energy supplier has apologized for the "poorly judged and unhelpful" advice sent to customers which suggested they could snuggle up to their pets and exercise to cut back on their heating bills.

title: The world's most powerful passports for 2022
description: There's a widening gap between the global north and the global south when it comes to travel freedoms, says the first 2022 report by London-based global citizenship and residence advisory firm Henley & Partners.

title: Oceans were the warmest on record in 2021, for the 3rd year in a row
Novak Djokovic is 'the best player in the history of men's tennis' but he is leaving a 'complicated' legacy off the court
New York Bronx fire a 'shock in our country' Gambia ambassador says
description: The Bronx apartment building that was devastated by a deadly fire Sunday had been a beloved home for many immigrants from The Gambia for years, the West African country's ambassador to the US told CNN.

title: Boris Johnson embroiled in 'bring-your-own-booze' party scandal
description: British Prime Minister Boris Johnson has more questions to answer after it emerged on Monday that one of his top officials sent an invitation to a Downing Street party to dozens of employees amid the first Covid-19 lockdown in the country.

title: World No. 1 speedskater Erin Jackson is going to Beijing 2022 after teammate gives up place
description: The world's No. 1 ranked speedskater Erin Jackson is headed to the Beijing Olympics after her friend and teammate gave up her spot after a slip during qualifying trials cost Jackson a place in the team.

title: European Parliament President David Sassoli dies age 65
description: European Parliament President David Sassoli has died in Italy, according to a Tweet from his spokesman early Tuesday local time.

title: Amanpour presses diplomat on shoot-to-kill orders
description: CNN's Christiane Amanpour presses Kazakh diplomat Erzhan Kazykhanov who defends the president Kassym-Jomart Tokayev's order to 'kill without warning.'

title: Rachel Balkovec to become first woman to manage a minor league team
description: Rachel Balkovec will become the first woman to manage a minor league team.

title: Meet the Ghanaian Canadian Lego sculptor building a Black universe
description: For 42-year-old Ghanaian Canadian artist Ekow Nimako, Lego is more than just a kids' toy. A trickster deity in the form of a spider, a flower girl holding a giant bee and a Ghanaian kingdom in the year 3020 are all sculptures that he has built using only black Legos.

title: State senator apologizes for saying educators need to be impartial when teaching about Nazism and fascism
description: An Indiana lawmaker is apologizing for saying teachers should exercise impartiality when teaching about Nazism or fascism.

title: From Europe to US, Covid cases in children are surging
description: As Covid-19 cases skyrocketed across Britain in late December, Stuart Guest spent his vacation poring over scientific reports about air cleaning and filtration systems.

title: Suspected North Korea missile test hit speed of Mach 10, Seoul says
description: North Korea launched an unidentified projectile, or projectiles, off its east coast Tuesday, South Korea's Joint Chiefs of Staff said in a text message to media.

title: China appoints former paramilitary chief as new Hong Kong garrison commander
description: China has appointed a former paramilitary chief, Peng Jingtang, as the new commander of the People Liberation Army's (PLA) garrison in Hong Kong, state broadcaster CCTV reported, citing the PLA's spokesman.

title: Giant 180 million-year-old 'sea dragon' fossil found in UK reservoir
description: The colossal 180 million-year-old fossilized remains of an ichthyosaur have been found in the UK, in what researchers have described as one of the most significant discoveries in the region.

title: Betty White died of a stroke
description: Actress Betty White died after suffering a stroke six days prior, according to her death certificate.

title: 16 top colleges sued for alleged violation of federal antitrust laws by colluding on their financial-aid practices
description: Sixteen top US universities, including Duke, Vanderbilt and Northwestern, are being sued by five former students claiming those schools may be involved in antitrust violations in the way those institutions worked together in determining financial aid awards for students, according to the lawsuit filed in a US District Court in Illinois.

title: If Democrats can't pass their agenda now, they may not get another chance for years
description: The last four times a president went into midterm elections holding unified control of the White House, Senate and House of Representatives, as Joe Biden and Democrats do now, voters have revoked it.

title: Prosecutors agree to dismiss perjury counts Ghislaine Maxwell faces if her conviction sticks
description: Prosecutors have agreed to dismiss separate perjury counts Ghislaine Maxwell faces at sentencing if she is unsuccessful in getting a new trial "in light of the victims' significant interests in bringing closure to this matter and avoiding the trauma of testifying again," according to a court filing on Monday.

title: In a medical first, a man with terminal heart disease gets a transplant of genetically modified pig heart
description: A 57-year-old Maryland man is doing well three days after receiving a genetically modified pig heart in a first-of-its-kind transplant surgery, University of Maryland Medicine said in a news release Monday.

title: US says no breakthrough in 'frank and forthright' talks with Russia over Ukraine border crisis
description: American and Russian officials are holding high-stakes talks Monday about the build-up of troops on Ukraine's border, as fears mount over a possible Russian invasion.

title: Hear from doctors who transplanted a genetically modified pig heart to a man
description: A team of doctors of at the University of Maryland performed the first transplant of a genetically modified pig heart to a 57-year-old man with terminal heart disease.

title: Bob Saget's cause of death being investigated
description: An autopsy was completed on Bob Saget Monday, according to the Orange County Medical Examiner in Florida.

title: US quietly authorized 200 million dollars for Ukraine security
description: The United States and Russia held talks lasting more than seven hours in Geneva, Switzerland. This follows months of tension near the Ukraine-Russia border, where there are more than 100,000 Russian soldiers. CNN's Alex Marquardt has more.

title: The photographer taking a serious look at child's play
description: For more than a decade, Nancy Richards Farese has been capturing heartwarming images of children around the world, from Burkina Faso to Honduras, Ethiopia to Spain. Throughout her travels, the American photographer has observed a common trait that seems to transcend cultures: "They play," she said on a video call from Boston, "despite what's going on."

title: This is how much the climate crisis cost in 2021
description: Climate disasters cost the United States a total of $145 billion in 2021, according to a new report from the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration. CNN's Rene Marsh has more.

title: Maya Angelou becomes first Black woman to appear on US quarter
description: A new US quarter featuring the late Maya Angelou went into circulation Monday, the US Mint announced, making the legendary poet and activist the first Black woman ever to appear on the coin.

title: Al Sharpton delivers eulogy for 14-year-old girl shot by LAPD
description: Family, friends and community activists gathered in southern California on Monday for the funeral of Valentina Orellana-Peralta, the 14-year-old fatally shot by a Los Angeles police officer while Christmas shopping with her mother.

title: Ex-'American Idol' star Clay Aiken announces bid for Congress
description: Clay Aiken, widely known for his stint on "American Idol," announced Monday that he's launching another bid for Congress in North Carolina.
